sage.scene.state

Class TextureStateRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.state.RenderStateRecord
      • sage.scene.state.TextureStateRecord

  • public class TextureStateRecord
extends RenderStateRecord
    * TextureStateRecord holds a record of the current TextureState values stored in a RenderContext. Each TextureStateRecord holds data describing a texture state, including a set of TextureRecords and a set of TextureUnitRecords.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextureStateRecord

        public TextureStateRecord(JOGLContextCapabilities caps,
                          int maxUnits)
        Constructs a TextureStateRecord for keeping track of texture states. Each TextureStateRecord contains a collection of TextureRecords and a collection of TextureUnitRecords, each containing one entry for each texture or texture unit tracked by this TextureStateRecord.

    • Method Detail

      • getTextureRecord

        public TextureRecord getTextureRecord(int textureId,
                                      Texture.TextureType type)
        Returns the TextureRecord in this TextureStateRecord corresponding to the specified Texture ID and Texture.TextureType. If no TextureRecord exists for the specified texture, a new TextureRecord is created.
        Parameters:
        textureId - - the OpenGL texture ID for the texture of interest
        type - - the type of the texture referenced by textureId
        Returns:
        a TextureRecord for the specified texture

        public static int getGLPixelFormat(int format)
        Returns the OpenGL constant corresponding to the pixel packing format represented by the specified integer, which is expected to be one of the format types specified by static Type fields in BufferedImage.
        Returns:
        an OpenGL enumeration constant
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified integer does not correspond to a supported pixel format mapping
